project_p3.meta.title: Habit Analyzer — Victor de Alcântara Bueno
project_p3.meta.description: Web app for habit tracking with analytics and reports.
project_p3.hero.title: Habit Analyzer
project_p3.hero.subtitle: Web habit tracking app with API and dashboard.
project_p3.hero.delivery: Delivery: REST API (FastAPI) + frontend (Next.js) with authentication and charts.
project_p3.tldr.problem: tracking habits tends to end up in spreadsheets/notes, with little insight and low consistency.
project_p3.tldr.solution: an app with a FastAPI backend (JWT) and a Next.js/TypeScript frontend with an entry flow and per-habit charts.
project_p3.tldr.result: a working MVP with Docker Compose, Swagger/OpenAPI docs, and tests (pytest + Playwright E2E).
project_p3.snapshot.col2: Multiple habits per user, daily entries, and enough history for charts and trends.
project_p3.snapshot.col3: Consistent data (dates/values), authentication, and safe schema evolution with migrations.
project_p3.problem_impact.symptoms: scattered manual tracking and low visibility into consistency/progress.
project_p3.problem_impact.cause: data without a single model and without an aggregated view of per-habit history.
project_p3.problem_impact.impact: lower adherence and worse routine decisions due to lack of signal.
project_p3.approach.step1: habits and entries (domain) and persist them in Postgres.
project_p3.approach.step2: a REST API with FastAPI and JWT authentication.
project_p3.approach.step3: in the web dashboard (Next.js) with an entry flow and per-habit charts.
project_p3.approach.figure1_alt: Analytics visual: summary and cache code snippet
project_p3.approach.figure1_caption: Snapshot: chart UI consuming an API summary.
project_p3.approach.diagram:
Action → POST /api/v1/records (creates entry)
Persistence → Postgres + migrations
GET /api/v1/records/habit/'habit_id'/summary → time series
Frontend → Chart.js renders progress
project_p3.approach.figure2_caption: Diagram: from entry to the summary that feeds the charts.
project_p3.reliability.risks: inconsistent data (dates/values), auth regressions, and mismatches between summary and time series.
project_p3.reliability.guarantees: validation with Pydantic, migrations with Alembic, and tests (unit + Playwright E2E on the critical flow).
project_p3.reliability.evidence: README, an OpenAPI snapshot, and a test suite in the repository.
project_p3.next.item1: Add goals, streaks, and reminders to reinforce adherence.
project_p3.next.item3: Observability: API metrics and errors for safer iteration.
project_p3.conversion.p: If you need a habit-tracking MVP with API and dashboard (auth + charts), I design the architecture, implement the critical flow, and validate it with tests.
